name: Quesnelia
description: Quesnelia is a genus of about 20 species of flowering plants in the family Bromeliaceae, endemic to eastern and southeastern Brazil.These plants form stiff, upright rosettes of solid green leaves. The flowers are cone-shaped and bloom primarily in winter. They are easy to grow and require very little maintenance. They are drought tolerant once established and cold tolerant.
meaning: The genus name was given in honor of M. Quesnel, who was a consul in French Guiana.
color_description: The flowers come in red, blue, pink and yellow colors.
